Picturing Some of the Principles of Child Care Album -- Mother Cutting Meat for Baby
circa 1948 1948 Date taken from handwritten note on album cover photographs reformatted digital preservation
still image Annotation on back: INCA #187 - Infant Care Subject: Mother Cutting Meat for Baby Credit photo to: Harmon Foundation Description: JUNIOR CAN'T CUT HIS FOOD AND HE CANT SPREAD HIS BREAD. BUT OUTSIDE OF THAT HE CAN MANAGE EATING VERY WELL BY HIMSELF, THANK YOU. HE DOESN'T HAVE TO GO TO BED QUITE SO EARLY NOW AND HOW HE DOES ENJOY BEING A MEMBER OF THE FAMILY AT DINNER, WITH HIS OWN PLACE AT THE TABLE RIGHT BETWEEN MUMMY AND DADDY. Item no. 1167 From CSS Department Educational Nursing "Picturing Some of the Principles of Child Care" Album, circa 1948. Photos taken by U.S. Dept. of War Info to show child care in USA. Album dated "circa 1948" and the Department of War Information operated between 1942-1945.
